children.name: charter
children.definition: , informal a law or official decision which seems to give someone the right to do something that most people think is morally wrong and should not be allowed :điều lệ, đặc quyền, hạn định
examples: charter for sb to do sth:
This housing law would be a charter for dishonest landlords to cheat their tenants.
thieves’/tax dodgers’ etc charter:
The police decision to reduce their burglary squad has been described as ‘a thieves’ charter'.

children.name: law
children.definition: an official rule that everyone in a country or place must obey: luật
examples: This law makes it illegal to smoke in public places.
The law defines drunkenness as a certain percentage of alcohol in the blood.
law against
Japan has very strict laws against guns and drugs.
law on
tough new laws on immigration
Both specific and general laws on child prostitution exist.
a tax/ gun/ immigration etc law
The current gun laws vary from state to state.
under the law/according to the law
Under the new law, anyone who assists in a suicide faces 10 years in prison.

children.name: act
children.definition: a law made by parliament or Congress - used in the official name of a law: luật (dùng trong tên của một bộ luật)

children.name: the 1991 Prevention of Terrorism Act
examples: The Wagner Act prohibited employers from firing workers for joining a union.

children.name: legislation
children.definition: a set of laws, especially ones that are made to control a new problem : pháp chế
examples: Legislation is needed to stop the spread of computer pornography.
The legislation requires motorcyclists to wear helmets.
The government has promised to introduce legislationtolimit fuel emissions from cars.
legislation on
new legislation on the sale of alcohol

children.name: bill
children.definition: a new lawthat has to be approved by members of the government before it can officially become a law: bản dự luật, bản luật dự thảo
examples: Monday’s debate on the defense bill lasted all night.
The bill wasamended(= changed) .
When a bill ispassedin parliament it becomes law.
informalThe bill wasthrown out(= did not go past the first stage of discussion and will not become law) .

children.name: sign a billto approve a bill so that it becomes a law : kí bản dự luật
examples: The president signed a bill that will help more families move from welfare to work.

children.name: statute
children.definition: a law that has been officially established by the government so that it is written down as the law: đạo luật
examples: In New Mexico, a state statute permits one minute of silent prayer at the beginning of school.
Unfortunately his lawyer could find no statute or point of law preventing his client’s imprisonment.

children.name: ordinance
children.definition: bylaw/  a law made by local government that people in a particular area or place must obey: luật địa phương
examples: Fishing on this river is forbidden under a local bylaw.
a city ordinance prohibiting smoking in government buildings.

children.name: rule
children.definition: an instruction that says what people are allowed to do or not allowed to do, for example in a game, or in a school or organization: quy định, quy tắc
examples: No one’s allowed to ride with the driver. That’s a company rule.
It says in the rules that every child has to wear school uniform.

children.name: regulation
children.definition: an official rule made by a government or organization, which is part of a set of rules: quy định
examples: Under the new regulations, coach drivers must take a break every four hours.
The correct procedure is laid down in therules andregulations.
government regulationofinflation
building/ planning/ environmental regulations
The building regulations are very strict about the materials you can use.
safety/fire regulations
Safety regulations affecting dangerous fluids must be scrupulously observed.
comply with/ conform to a regulation[be correct according to a regulation] tuân thủ quy định
All cars sold in Germany must conform to the regulations laid down by the Federal Road Safety Board.
contravene/ breach a regulation[formal do something that is forbidden by it] vi phạm quy định
Anyone who takes milk from an unhealthy cow will be contravening public health regulations.

children.name: red tape
children.definition: complicated and annoying official rules that you have to obey before you can do or have sth : quy tắc, thủ tục (rườm rà để có được cái gì )
examples: There’s so much red tape involved in getting a work permit.

children.name: cut through red tapeavoid it cắt bỏ những quy tắc
examples: There must be a way to cut through all this red tape.
We mustcut throughthe red tape.

children.name: law
children.definition: /lɔː/  one of the rules that say how a sport should be played:
examples: luật chơi
▪ FIFA is the organization that runs world football and decides whether any of the laws should be changed.
FIFA là tổ chức điều hành bóng đá thế giới và quyết định có nên thay đổi bất cứ luật chơi nào.
law of
luật chơi của
▪ the laws of cricket
Luật chơi của môn Criket

children.name: code
children.definition: a set of rules that people or organizations agree to obey but are not forced to obey: quy tắc
examples: code of
He will be dealt with under our code of discipline.
code of practice[rules saying what a particular type of organization should or should not do] : quy tắc thực hiện
A new code of practice governing the advertising of tobacco products is being introduced.
code of conduct[rules saying how members of a profession should behave] quy tắc ứng xử
Hobbs had blatantly ignored the legal profession’s code of conduct.
moral/religious codequy tắc đạo đức/tôn giáo
people who follow some strict religious code

children.name: rules and regulations
children.definition: a set of rules-use this when you think the rules are too detailed or cause unnecessary inconvenience : những quy tắc luật lệ (dùng khi hàm ý quá nhình nhằng không cần thiết)
examples: There were so many petty rules and regulations that some companies stopped trying to export their products.

children.name: the whole system of laws of a place
legal system U
children.definition: legal system/ˈliːgəl ˌsɪstm/  the laws and the way that they work in a particular country:

children.name: hệ thống pháp luật
examples: ▪ Many people here have no faith in the legal system and do not expect to receive justice from it.
▪ The American legal system says that you are innocent until proven guilty.

children.name: law
children.definition: the whole system of laws that everyone in a country or place must obey: pháp luật
examples: Andrew is studying law at Harvard University.
In 1873 French law was imposed in Vietnam.
federal law[US] a law that everyone in the nation must obey luật liên bang
state law[US] a law that everyone in a state must obey luật tiểu bang
international lawlaws that govern how nations behave toward each other luật quốc tế
Refugees are accorded special protection under international law
law and orderrespect for the system of laws tôn trọng luật lệ
The soldiers were brought in to restore law and order after the riots.
by lawaccording to the system of laws
By law, an advertiser can’t use a person’s name for commercial purposes without permission.
against the lawillegal because it is not part of the system of laws theo luật
It’s against the law to be drunk in public.
break the lawdisobey the law trái luật, phá luật
I didn’t realize I was breaking the law.

children.name: when the law says you must do sth or have the right to do it
legal
children.definition: your legal rights, duties etc are the ones that the law says you have : hợp pháp (nói về quyền, nghĩa vụ ... bạn sở hữu)
examples: Consumers have the legal right to demand their money back if a product is faulty.
legallyB2[Adv] according to the law : một cách hợp pháp
If there is an accident, the owner of the vehicle will be legally responsible.
When does the contract become legally binding?
legally authorized/ obliged/ able etc
Is my live-in girlfriend legally entitled to a share of the proceeds from the sale of the house?
Employers are legally obliged to consult trade unions about any redundancy proposals.

children.name: the legal duties of a parent
examples: The alcohol content of his blood was three times over the legal limit.
The clerk to the court will reject any document that does not meet the legal requirements.

children.name: the legal owner: người sở hữu hợp pháp
examples: She now become the legal owner of the land.

children.name: statutory
children.definition: do luật pháp quy định, được ấn định theo luật,

children.name: constitutional
children.definition: legal, according to the system of rules of a country: theo hiến pháp, đúng với hiến pháp
examples: Nobody seemed to know whether the President’s action was constitutional or not.
A court decision in 1954 ruled that segregated education was not constitutional.
Such a policy would not be constitutional.
constitutionally[adv] according to the rules in a constitution : căn cứ theo hiến pháp, hợp hiến
There was some doubt as to whether the government were behaving constitutionally.
Although unusual, the Governor’s action was constitutionally quite correct.

children.name: constitutional rights
examples: The court will rule on whether the prisoner’s constitutional rights were violated.
Freedom of speech should be a constitutionalright.

children.name: according to the law
children.definition: if sth is done according to the law, it is done as the law says it should be : theo luật pháp
examples: The police must ensure that all interviews and interrogations are carried out according to the law.
Islamic court officials said the men would be tried according to Sharia Muslim law.
According to Singapore law, the immigration officers were within their rights to refuse me admission.

children.name: by law
children.definition: if sth must be done by law, it must legally be done: theo luật pháp
examples: By law, the purchase must be completed within a month after the contracts are signed.

children.name: be required/ allowed by law
examples: The wearing of seat belts in cars is required by law.
Donations must not exceed the limits that are allowed by law.
The government is required by law to provide education for all minors.

children.name: when a law is officially accepted
become law
children.definition: if a new or suggested law becomes law, it is officially accepted and starts to exist: trở thành luật
examples: The Education Bill finally became law last month.
Until the Food Protection Bill became law, the ministry had no power to ban dangerous pesticides.

children.name: be on the books
children.definition: get onto/reach the statute book /  if a law gets onto the statute book, it officially becomes a law: được ghi vào luật
examples: The Employment Bill was passed in 1982 but did not reach the statute book until 1984.
The laws have been on the books for decades, but city officials failed to enforce them.

children.name: legal
children.definition: connected with laws and courts : pháp luật , pháp lý
examples: legal battle/dispute[when two people or organizations disagree about something, and this is judged in a court of law] tranh chấp pháp lý
Neither side wanted a long and expensive legal battle.
legal feesmoney you have to pay lawyers
The American government does not pay the legal fees of Americans who are arrested abroad.

children.name: legal advice:tư vấn pháp lý
examples: People on low salaries can get free legal advice.

children.name: loophole
children.definition: a detail that is missing from a law or legal document that makes it possible to avoid sth in that law: lỗ hổng
examples: He pays very little tax because of some loophole in income tax legislation.
